gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ ਮਕਰੰਦ ਰਸ ਲੁਭਿਤ ਹੁੲਿ ਸਹਜ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਸੁਖ ਸੰਪਟ ਸਮਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Kamal Makarand Ras Loubhit Hui , Sahaj Samaadhi Soukh Sanpat Samaanay Hai ?
translation: By becoming a true servant of Satguru Ji, remaining fond of the fragrance of the dust of the holy feet of the True Guru, and in perpetual contemplation, a Sikh permeates himself in the spiritual peace.

gurmukhi: ਭੈਜਲ ਭੲਿਅਾਨਕ ਲਹਰਿ ਨ ਬਿਅਾਪਿ ਸਕੈ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਨਿਵਾਰਿ ੲੇਕ ਟੇਕ ਠਹਰਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Bhaijal Bhaiaanak Lahari N Biaapi Sakai , Doubidhaa Nivaari Ayk Tayk Tthaharaanay Hai ?
translation: Guru-conscious person is never affected by the frightening worldly waves of desires and hopes. He is deemed to have destroyed all duality and taken the refuge of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਬਰਜਿ ਬਿਸਰਜਤ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਨੇਮ ਬਿਸਮ ਬਿਸ੍ਵਾਸ ੳੁਰ ਅਾਨੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Drisati Sabad Surati Baraji Bisarajata , Praym Naym Bisam Bisvaas Ur Aanay Hai ?
translation: He keeps his eyes away from the evils and ears closed to the slander and praise. Ever engrossed in Naam Simran, he imbibes the celestial faith of the Lord in his mind.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਜਗਜੀਵਨ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੂਲ ਅਾਪਾ ਖੋੲਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਪਰੰਪਰ ਪਰਾਨੈ ਹੈ ॥੯੨॥
transliteration: Jeevan Moukati Jagajeevan Jeevan Moola , Aapaa Khoi Hoi Aparanpar Paraanai Hai ?92?
translation: Liberated Guru-conscious Sikh sheds all his ego and becomes a devotee of the infinite Lord, the creator of the World and source of all life on it. (92)
